episodeTitle: A Mastermind Underground! Doflamingo Makes His Move!
episodeTitleJapanese: 闇の黒幕!ドフラミンゴ動く
description: Law infiltrates the SAD production facility while Doflamingo is revealed as the mastermind orchestrating events from Dressrosa. After ordering Vergo to eliminate Law, Doflamingo dispatches reinforcements to Punk Hazard. Meanwhile, the Straw Hats defeat a dragon and learn that Momonosuke transformed after entering a forbidden room.

events.title: Law Enters the SAD Production Room
events.description: Trafalgar Law successfully infiltrates Section D and enters the massive SAD production facility. He looks up at the giant tank labeled 'SAD' and smiles, having reached his objective.
events.significance: This marks a crucial step in Law's plan to disrupt Doflamingo's operations and ultimately take down Kaido. The SAD production is key to Caesar's artificial Devil Fruit manufacturing.

events.title: Sanji Survives Section A Closure
events.description: After Section A's door closes, Sanji emerges from above, revealing he survived his confrontation with Vergo. The battle ended early because Vergo fled the scene.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's resilience and fighting ability against a powerful Vice Admiral. Also shows Vergo prioritizing his mission over completing the fight.

quotes.text: The battle ended early because that guy ran off somewhere.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji explaining why he's still alive after facing Vergo

events.title: Vergo Uses Geppo
events.description: Vergo demonstrates the Rokushiki technique Geppo (Moon Walk), using it to traverse the air and return to his original position after fleeing from Sanji.
events.significance: Showcases Vergo's mastery of Marine techniques and his high level of combat ability as a Vice Admiral and undercover agent.

events.title: Doflamingo Revealed as Vergo's True Master
events.description: Vergo contacts Doflamingo via Den Den Mushi, revealing that the Marine Vice Admiral is actually a mole working for the Donquixote Pirates. They discuss Law's betrayal and infiltration of the SAD room.
events.significance: Major revelation that a high-ranking Marine officer is actually a pirate spy, showing the depth of Doflamingo's influence. This establishes Doflamingo as a major antagonist and mastermind.

quotes.text: Young master, Law has reached the SAD production room.
quotes.speaker: Vergo
quotes.context: Vergo reporting Law's infiltration to Doflamingo

events.title: Doflamingo's Major Scene at Dressrosa
events.description: Donquixote Doflamingo is shown at his palace in Dressrosa, surrounded by his crew members including Baby 5, Sugar, Machvise, Gladius, Giolla, and Lao G. He remains calm while Baby 5 attacks him during his conversation with Vergo.
events.significance: First major scene establishing Doflamingo as the puppet master behind Punk Hazard's events. Introduces multiple key members of the Donquixote Pirates who will be important in the Dressrosa Arc.

events.title: Baby 5 Anime Debut
events.description: Baby 5, a member of the Donquixote Pirates, makes her anime debut. She attacks Doflamingo with an axe while he's speaking with Vergo, demonstrating her Devil Fruit ability to transform her body parts into weapons.
events.significance: Introduces Baby 5's character and her Buki Buki no Mi (Arms-Arms Fruit) abilities. Shows her volatile personality and her role as one of Doflamingo's officers.

events.title: Sugar Anime Debut
events.description: Sugar, a young-looking member of the Donquixote Pirates, makes her anime debut. She sits beside Doflamingo on one of his chairs outside the palace, calmly eating grapes while Baby 5 attacks their captain.
events.significance: Introduces Sugar, who will later be revealed as one of the most crucial members of Doflamingo's operation in Dressrosa with her Hobi Hobi no Mi ability.

events.title: Machvise, Gladius, Giolla, and Lao G Anime Debuts
events.description: Multiple officers of the Donquixote Pirates make their anime debuts: Machvise stands behind Doflamingo, Gladius shoots Baby 5 to calm her down, and Giolla and Lao G are also present at the palace.
events.significance: Introduces several key members of the Donquixote Family who will play important roles in the Dressrosa Arc, showcasing the size and organization of Doflamingo's crew.

events.title: Doflamingo Stops Baby 5's Attack
events.description: Doflamingo effortlessly dodges Baby 5's axe attack and uses his String-String Fruit powers to stop her, demonstrating his Devil Fruit abilities and complete control over the situation.
events.significance: Shows Doflamingo's mastery of his Ito Ito no Mi powers and establishes his dominance over his crew members, even when attacked by them.

events.title: Doflamingo Orders Law's Execution
events.description: Doflamingo orders Vergo to kill Trafalgar Law with absolutely no mercy, to the point that Law will wish he was never born. This command reveals the deep animosity and betrayal Doflamingo feels toward his former subordinate.
events.significance: Establishes the deadly conflict between Doflamingo and Law, setting up major confrontations. Shows Doflamingo's ruthlessness and the severity of Law's betrayal.

quotes.text: Kill Law, with absolutely no mercy to the point that Law will wish he was never born.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo ordering Vergo to eliminate the traitor Law

quotes.text: I look forward to seeing it!
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo's response when Vergo offers to cut off Law's ear

events.title: Doflamingo Dispatches Baby 5 and Buffalo
events.description: Doflamingo sends two of his officers, Baby 5 and Buffalo, to Punk Hazard as reinforcements to deal with the situation and protect his interests in Caesar's operations.
events.significance: Shows Doflamingo actively moving to protect his SAD production and Caesar Clown. Sets up future confrontations at Punk Hazard.

events.title: Straw Hats Defeat the Dragon
events.description: The Straw Hats, riding on Brownbeard and joined by Kin'emon and Brook, are chased by a small dragon. Brook and Kin'emon deliver the finishing blows, defeating the dragon creature.
events.significance: Unknown to the Straw Hats, they've just attacked Momonosuke in his artificial Devil Fruit-transformed state, creating dramatic irony for viewers who will later learn the dragon's true identity.

events.title: Nami's Thunder Trap
events.description: Nami uses her Thunder Trap technique during the battle against the dragon, showcasing her meteorological combat abilities with the Clima-Tact.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's continued development of her weather-based fighting techniques post-timeskip.

events.title: Robin's Cuarenta Fleur: Cuatro Mano Hold
events.description: Nico Robin uses her Cuarenta Fleur: Cuatro Mano Hold technique, sprouting forty flower limbs to restrain the dragon during the battle.
events.significance: Shows Robin's refined use of her Hana Hana no Mi abilities, demonstrating her post-timeskip combat prowess.

events.title: Kin'emon's Karyu Issen
events.description: Kin'emon uses his fire-cutting sword technique Karyu Issen as part of the finishing blow against the dragon.
events.significance: Showcases Kin'emon's samurai abilities and his unique fire-cutting technique that will be important throughout the arc.

events.title: Momonosuke's Transformation Revealed
events.description: A young girl (one of the kidnapped children) reveals to the Straw Hats that Momonosuke, a boy they're searching for, entered a forbidden secret room and transformed into a small dragon after eating something there.
events.significance: Major revelation about Caesar's artificial Devil Fruit experiments and explains the dragon's true identity. This is a crucial plot point connecting to the overall Punk Hazard mystery.

quotes.text: Momo went into the forbidden secret room and turned into a small dragon!
quotes.speaker: Young Girl

events.title: Monet Names Her Devil Fruit
events.description: Monet appears in a massive snowstorm in the Biscuit Room and reveals herself as a Snow Human who ate the Yuki Yuki no Mi (Snow-Snow Fruit), a Logia-type Devil Fruit.
events.significance: Official naming and confirmation of Monet's Devil Fruit ability. Establishes her as a formidable Logia user and major threat to Luffy and the others.

quotes.text: I am a Snow Human who ate the Yuki Yuki no Mi.
quotes.speaker: Monet
quotes.context: Monet revealing her Devil Fruit powers to Luffy

events.title: Luffy vs. Monet Begins
events.description: Monet confronts Luffy in the Biscuit Room, demonstrating her snow powers and beginning their battle. She creates a massive snowstorm and uses her abilities to attack Luffy.
events.significance: Sets up a Logia user confrontation for Luffy, testing his post-timeskip abilities and Haki. Also shows Monet's role as Caesar's protector under Doflamingo's orders.

quotes.text: Kill Law, with absolutely no mercy to the point that Law will wish he was never born.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo

quotes.text: I look forward to seeing it!
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Responding to Vergo's offer to bring Law's ear

quotes.text: I am a Snow Human who ate the Yuki Yuki no Mi.
quotes.speaker: Monet

quotes.text: Momo went into the forbidden secret room and turned into a small dragon!
quotes.speaker: Young Girl

themes.description: The episode explores themes of betrayal through Law's defection from Doflamingo and Vergo's double life as a Marine and pirate. It also examines loyalty through the Donquixote Family's devotion to Doflamingo.
themes.symbolism: The puppet master imagery reinforces Doflamingo's role as someone who controls and manipulates others, pulling strings from the shadows.

themes.description: Multiple layers of deception are revealed: Vergo's true identity, Doflamingo as the mastermind, and Momonosuke's transformation. The episode emphasizes that things are not what they seem.
themes.symbolism: The shadows and darkness associated with Doflamingo's title 'The Mastermind in the Shadows' represent the hidden conspiracies at work.

characterSpotlights.development: Doflamingo is established as a major villain and mastermind, showing his ruthlessness, power, and extensive criminal organization. His calm demeanor contrasts with his brutal orders.
keyActions: Receives report from Vergo about Law's betrayal
quotes: Kill Law, with absolutely no mercy to the point that Law will wish he was never born.
I look forward to seeing it!

characterSpotlights.development: Law's careful planning comes to fruition as he reaches the SAD room, but his past with Doflamingo creates deadly consequences.
keyActions: Successfully infiltrates the SAD production room

characterSpotlights.development: Vergo's true allegiance to Doflamingo is confirmed, revealing him as a high-ranking Marine mole and adding complexity to the Marine organization.
keyActions: Uses Geppo to traverse the facility

characterSpotlights.development: Monet officially reveals her Devil Fruit ability and confronts Luffy, showing her dedication to protecting Caesar under Doflamingo's orders.
keyActions: Reveals Yuki Yuki no Mi ability
quotes: I am a Snow Human who ate the Yuki Yuki no Mi.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several scenes with the Straw Hats fighting the dragon, adding more action sequences than in the original manga.
The Dressrosa palace scene with Doflamingo and his crew was expanded in the anime with more dialogue and character reactions.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first major appearance of Doflamingo as an active antagonist in the anime, setting up his role as one of One Piece's most significant villains.
Episode 608 debuts six members of the Donquixote Pirates simultaneously: Baby 5, Sugar, Machvise, Gladius, Giolla, and Lao G.
The episode aired on August 18, 2013 in Japan and received a TV rating of 7.0%, ranking 4th for that time slot.
Hideyuki Tanaka's portrayal of Doflamingo in this episode was particularly praised by fans for the sinister music and intimidating voice acting.
